3150
3151int
3152pcap_getnonblock(pcap_t *p, char *errbuf)
3153{
3154 int ret;
3155
3156 ret = p->getnonblock_op(p);
3157 if (ret == -1) {
3158 /*
3159 * The get nonblock operation sets p->errbuf; this
3160 * function *shouldn't* have had a separate errbuf
3161 * argument, as it didn't need one, but I goofed
3162 * when adding it.
3163 *
3164 * We copy the error message to errbuf, so callers
3165 * can find it in either place.
3166 */
3167 strlcpy(errbuf, p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE);
3168 }
3169 return (ret);
3170}
3171
3172/*
3173 * Get the current non-blocking mode setting, under the assumption that
3174 * it's just the standard POSIX non-blocking flag.
3175 */
3176#if !defined(_WIN32) && !defined(MSDOS)
3177int
3178pcap_getnonblock_fd(pcap_t *p)
3179{
3180 int fdflags;
3181
3182 fdflags = fcntl(p->fd, F_GETFL, 0);
3183 if (fdflags == -1) {
3184 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
3185 errno, "F_GETFL");
3186 return (-1);
3187 }
3188 if (fdflags & O_NONBLOCK)
3189 return (1);
3190 else
3191 return (0);
3192}
3193#endif
3194
3195int
3196pcap_setnonblock(pcap_t *p, int nonblock, char *errbuf)
3197{
3198 int ret;
3199
3200 ret = p->setnonblock_op(p, nonblock);
3201 if (ret == -1) {
3202 /*
3203 * The set nonblock operation sets p->errbuf; this
3204 * function *shouldn't* have had a separate errbuf
3205 * argument, as it didn't need one, but I goofed
3206 * when adding it.
3207 *
3208 * We copy the error message to errbuf, so callers
3209 * can find it in either place.
3210 */
3211 strlcpy(errbuf, p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE);
3212 }
3213 return (ret);
3214}
3215
3216#if !defined(_WIN32) && !defined(MSDOS)
3217/*
3218 * Set non-blocking mode, under the assumption that it's just the
3219 * standard POSIX non-blocking flag. (This can be called by the
3220 * per-platform non-blocking-mode routine if that routine also
3221 * needs to do some additional work.)
3222 */
3223int
3224pcap_setnonblock_fd(pcap_t *p, int nonblock)
3225{
3226 int fdflags;
3227
3228 fdflags = fcntl(p->fd, F_GETFL, 0);
3229 if (fdflags == -1) {
3230 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
3231 errno, "F_GETFL");
3232 return (-1);
3233 }
3234 if (nonblock)
3235 fdflags |= O_NONBLOCK;
3236 else
3237 fdflags &= ~O_NONBLOCK;
3238 if (fcntl(p->fd, F_SETFL, fdflags) == -1) {
3239 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
3240 errno, "F_SETFL");
3241 return (-1);
3242 }
3243 return (0);
3244}
3245#endif
3246
3247#ifdef _WIN32
3248/*
3249 * Generate a string for a Win32-specific error (i.e. an error generated when
3250 * calling a Win32 API).
3251 * For errors occurred during standard C calls, we still use pcap_strerror()
3252 */
3253void
3254pcap_win32_err_to_str(DWORD error, char *errbuf)
3255{
3256 size_t errlen;
3257 char *p;
3258
3259 FormatMessageA(FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM, NULL, error, 0, errbuf,
3260 PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE, NULL);
3261
3262 /*
3263 * "FormatMessage()" "helpfully" sticks CR/LF at the end of the
3264 * message. Get rid of it.
3265 */
3266 errlen = strlen(errbuf);
3267 if (errlen >= 2) {
3268 errbuf[errlen - 1] = '\0';
3269 errbuf[errlen - 2] = '\0';
3270 }
3271 p = strchr(errbuf, '\0');
3272 pcap_snprintf (p, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE+1-(p-errbuf), " (%lu)", error);
3273}
3274#endif
3275
3276/*
3277 * Generate error strings for PCAP_ERROR_ and PCAP_WARNING_ values.
3278 */
3279const char *
3280pcap_statustostr(int errnum)
3281{
3282 static char ebuf[15+10+1];
3283
3284 switch (errnum) {
3285
3286 case PCAP_WARNING:
3287 return("Generic warning");
3288
3289 case PCAP_WARNING_TSTAMP_TYPE_NOTSUP:
3290 return ("That type of time stamp is not supported by that device");
3291
3292 case PCAP_WARNING_PROMISC_NOTSUP:
3293 return ("That device doesn't support promiscuous mode");
3294
3295 case PCAP_ERROR:
3296 return("Generic error");
3297
3298 case PCAP_ERROR_BREAK:
3299 return("Loop terminated by pcap_breakloop");
3300
3301 case PCAP_ERROR_NOT_ACTIVATED:
3302 return("The pcap_t has not been activated");
3303
3304 case PCAP_ERROR_ACTIVATED:
3305 return ("The setting can't be changed after the pcap_t is activated");
3306
3307 case PCAP_ERROR_NO_SUCH_DEVICE:
3308 return ("No such device exists");
3309
3310 case PCAP_ERROR_RFMON_NOTSUP:
3311 return ("That device doesn't support monitor mode");
3312
3313 case PCAP_ERROR_NOT_RFMON:
3314 return ("That operation is supported only in monitor mode");
3315
3316 case PCAP_ERROR_PERM_DENIED:
3317 return ("You don't have permission to capture on that device");
3318
3319 case PCAP_ERROR_IFACE_NOT_UP:
3320 return ("That device is not up");
3321
3322 case PCAP_ERROR_CANTSET_TSTAMP_TYPE:
3323 return ("That device doesn't support setting the time stamp type");
3324
3325 case PCAP_ERROR_PROMISC_PERM_DENIED:
3326 return ("You don't have permission to capture in promiscuous mode on that device");
3327
3328 case PCAP_ERROR_TSTAMP_PRECISION_NOTSUP:
3329 return ("That device doesn't support that time stamp precision");
3330 }
3331 (void)pcap_snprintf(ebuf, sizeof ebuf, "Unknown error: %d", errnum);
3332 return(ebuf);
3333}
3334
3335/*
3336 * Not all systems have strerror().
3337 */
3338const char *
3339pcap_strerror(int errnum)
3340{
3341#ifdef HAVE_STRERROR
3342#ifdef _WIN32
3343 static char errbuf[PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE];
3344 errno_t err = strerror_s(errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE, errnum);
3345
3346 if (err != 0) /* err = 0 if successful */
3347 strlcpy(errbuf, "strerror_s() error", PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE);
3348 return (errbuf);
3349#else
3350 return (strerror(errnum));
3351#endif /* _WIN32 */
3352#else
3353 extern int sys_nerr;
3354 extern const char *const sys_errlist[];
3355 static char errbuf[PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE];
3356
3357 if ((unsigned int)errnum < sys_nerr)
3358 return ((char *)sys_errlist[errnum]);
3359 (void)pcap_snprintf(errbuf, sizeof errbuf, "Unknown error: %d", errnum);
3360 return (errbuf);
3361#endif
3362}
3363
3364int
3365pcap_setfilter(pcap_t *p, struct bpf_program *fp)
3366{
3367 return (p->setfilter_op(p, fp));
3368}

3370/*
3371 * Set direction flag, which controls whether we accept only incoming
3372 * packets, only outgoing packets, or both.
3373 * Note that, depending on the platform, some or all direction arguments
3374 * might not be supported.
3375 */
3376int
3377pcap_setdirection(pcap_t *p, pcap_direction_t d)
3378{
3379 if (p->setdirection_op == NULL) {
3380 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
3381 "Setting direction is not implemented on this platform");
3382 return (-1);
3383 } else
3384 return (p->setdirection_op(p, d));
3385}

3435
3436pcap_send_queue *
3437pcap_sendqueue_alloc(u_int memsize)
3438{
3439 pcap_send_queue *tqueue;
3440
3441 /* Allocate the queue */
3442 tqueue = (pcap_send_queue *)malloc(sizeof(pcap_send_queue));
3443 if (tqueue == NULL){
3444 return (NULL);
3445 }
3446
3447 /* Allocate the buffer */
3448 tqueue->buffer = (char *)malloc(memsize);
3449 if (tqueue->buffer == NULL) {
3450 free(tqueue);
3451 return (NULL);
3452 }
3453
3454 tqueue->maxlen = memsize;
3455 tqueue->len = 0;
3456
3457 return (tqueue);
3458}
3459
3460void
3461pcap_sendqueue_destroy(pcap_send_queue *queue)
3462{
3463 free(queue->buffer);
3464 free(queue);
3465}
3466
3467int
3468pcap_sendqueue_queue(pcap_send_queue *queue, const struct pcap_pkthdr *pkt_header, const u_char *pkt_data)
3469{
3470 if (queue->len + sizeof(struct pcap_pkthdr) + pkt_header->caplen > queue->maxlen){
3471 return (-1);
3472 }
3473
3474 /* Copy the pcap_pkthdr header*/
3475 memcpy(queue->buffer + queue->len, pkt_header, sizeof(struct pcap_pkthdr));
3476 queue->len += sizeof(struct pcap_pkthdr);
3477
3478 /* copy the packet */
3479 memcpy(queue->buffer + queue->len, pkt_data, pkt_header->caplen);
3480 queue->len += pkt_header->caplen;
3481
3482 return (0);
3483}
3484
3485u_int
3486pcap_sendqueue_transmit(pcap_t *p, pcap_send_queue *queue, int sync)
3487{
3488 return (p->sendqueue_transmit_op(p, queue, sync));
3489}

3509PAirpcapHandle
3510pcap_get_airpcap_handle(pcap_t *p)
3511{
3512 PAirpcapHandle handle;
3513
3514 handle = p->get_airpcap_handle_op(p);
3515 if (handle == NULL) {
3516 (void)pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, sizeof(p->errbuf),
3517 "This isn't an AirPcap device");
3518 }
3519 return (handle);
3520}
3521#endif
3522
3523/*
3524 * On some platforms, we need to clean up promiscuous or monitor mode
3525 * when we close a device - and we want that to happen even if the
3526 * application just exits without explicitl closing devices.
3527 * On those platforms, we need to register a "close all the pcaps"
3528 * routine to be called when we exit, and need to maintain a list of
3529 * pcaps that need to be closed to clean up modes.
3530 *
3531 * XXX - not thread-safe.
3532 */
3533
3534/*
3535 * List of pcaps on which we've done something that needs to be
3536 * cleaned up.
3537 * If there are any such pcaps, we arrange to call "pcap_close_all()"
3538 * when we exit, and have it close all of them.
3539 */
3540static struct pcap *pcaps_to_close;
3541
3542/*
3543 * TRUE if we've already called "atexit()" to cause "pcap_close_all()" to
3544 * be called on exit.
3545 */
3546static int did_atexit;
3547
3548static void
3549pcap_close_all(void)
3550{
3551 struct pcap *handle;
3552
3553 while ((handle = pcaps_to_close) != NULL)
3554 pcap_close(handle);
3555}
3556
3557int
3558pcap_do_addexit(pcap_t *p)
3559{
3560 /*
3561 * If we haven't already done so, arrange to have
3562 * "pcap_close_all()" called when we exit.
3563 */
3564 if (!did_atexit) {
3565 if (atexit(pcap_close_all) != 0) {
3566 /*
3567 * "atexit()" failed; let our caller know.
3568 */
3569 strlcpy(p->errbuf, "atexit failed", PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE);
3570 return (0);
3571 }
3572 did_atexit = 1;
3573 }
3574 return (1);
3575}
3576
3577void
3578pcap_add_to_pcaps_to_close(pcap_t *p)
3579{
3580 p->next = pcaps_to_close;
3581 pcaps_to_close = p;
3582}
3583
3584void
3585pcap_remove_from_pcaps_to_close(pcap_t *p)
3586{
3587 pcap_t *pc, *prevpc;
3588
3589 for (pc = pcaps_to_close, prevpc = NULL; pc != NULL;
3590 prevpc = pc, pc = pc->next) {
3591 if (pc == p) {
3592 /*
3593 * Found it. Remove it from the list.
3594 */
3595 if (prevpc == NULL) {
3596 /*
3597 * It was at the head of the list.
3598 */
3599 pcaps_to_close = pc->next;
3600 } else {
3601 /*
3602 * It was in the middle of the list.
3603 */
3604 prevpc->next = pc->next;
3605 }
3606 break;
3607 }
3608 }
3609}
3610
3611void
3612pcap_cleanup_live_common(pcap_t *p)
3613{
3614 if (p->buffer != NULL) {
3615 free(p->buffer);
3616 p->buffer = NULL;
3617 }
3618 if (p->dlt_list != NULL) {
3619 free(p->dlt_list);
3620 p->dlt_list = NULL;
3621 p->dlt_count = 0;
3622 }
3623 if (p->tstamp_type_list != NULL) {
3624 free(p->tstamp_type_list);
3625 p->tstamp_type_list = NULL;
3626 p->tstamp_type_count = 0;
3627 }
3628 if (p->tstamp_precision_list != NULL) {
3629 free(p->tstamp_precision_list);
3630 p->tstamp_precision_list = NULL;
3631 p->tstamp_precision_count = 0;
3632 }
3633 pcap_freecode(&p->fcode);
3634#if !defined(_WIN32) && !defined(MSDOS)
3635 if (p->fd >= 0) {
3636 close(p->fd);
3637 p->fd = -1;
3638 }
3639 p->selectable_fd = -1;
3640#endif
3641}
3642
3643/*
3644 * API compatible with WinPcap's "send a packet" routine - returns -1
3645 * on error, 0 otherwise.
3646 *
3647 * XXX - what if we get a short write?
3648 */
3649int
3650pcap_sendpacket(pcap_t *p, const u_char *buf, int size)
3651{
3652 if (p->inject_op(p, buf, size) == -1)
3653 return (-1);
3654 return (0);
3655}
3656
3657/*
3658 * API compatible with OpenBSD's "send a packet" routine - returns -1 on
3659 * error, number of bytes written otherwise.
3660 */
3661int
3662pcap_inject(pcap_t *p, const void *buf, size_t size)
3663{
3664 return (p->inject_op(p, buf, size));
3665}
3666
3667void
3668pcap_close(pcap_t *p)
3669{
3670 if (p->opt.device != NULL)
3671 free(p->opt.device);
3672 p->cleanup_op(p);
3673 free(p);
3674}
3675
3676/*
3677 * Given a BPF program, a pcap_pkthdr structure for a packet, and the raw
3678 * data for the packet, check whether the packet passes the filter.
3679 * Returns the return value of the filter program, which will be zero if
3680 * the packet doesn't pass and non-zero if the packet does pass.
3681 */
3682int
3683pcap_offline_filter(const struct bpf_program *fp, const struct pcap_pkthdr *h,
3684 const u_char *pkt)
3685{
3686 const struct bpf_insn *fcode = fp->bf_insns;
3687
3688 if (fcode != NULL)
3689 return (bpf_filter(fcode, pkt, h->len, h->caplen));
3690 else
3691 return (0);
3692}

3870
3871pcap_t *
3872pcap_open_dead_with_tstamp_precision(int linktype, int snaplen, u_int precision)
3873{
3874 pcap_t *p;
3875
3876 switch (precision) {
3877
3878 case PCAP_TSTAMP_PRECISION_MICRO:
3879 case PCAP_TSTAMP_PRECISION_NANO:
3880 break;
3881
3882 default:
3883 /*
3884 * This doesn't really matter, but we don't have any way
3885 * to report particular errors, so the only failure we
3886 * should have is a memory allocation failure. Just
3887 * pick microsecond precision.
3888 */
3889 precision = PCAP_TSTAMP_PRECISION_MICRO;
3890 break;
3891 }
3892 p = malloc(sizeof(*p));
3893 if (p == NULL)
3894 return NULL;
3895 memset (p, 0, sizeof(*p));
3896 p->snapshot = snaplen;
3897 p->linktype = linktype;
3898 p->opt.tstamp_precision = precision;
3899 p->can_set_rfmon_op = pcap_can_set_rfmon_dead;
3900 p->read_op = pcap_read_dead;
3901 p->inject_op = pcap_inject_dead;
3902 p->setfilter_op = pcap_setfilter_dead;
3903 p->setdirection_op = pcap_setdirection_dead;
3904 p->set_datalink_op = pcap_set_datalink_dead;
3905 p->getnonblock_op = pcap_getnonblock_dead;
3906 p->setnonblock_op = pcap_setnonblock_dead;
3907 p->stats_op = pcap_stats_dead;
3908#ifdef _WIN32
3909 p->stats_ex_op = pcap_stats_ex_dead;
3910 p->setbuff_op = pcap_setbuff_dead;
3911 p->setmode_op = pcap_setmode_dead;
3912 p->setmintocopy_op = pcap_setmintocopy_dead;
3913 p->getevent_op = pcap_getevent_dead;
3914 p->oid_get_request_op = pcap_oid_get_request_dead;
3915 p->oid_set_request_op = pcap_oid_set_request_dead;
3916 p->sendqueue_transmit_op = pcap_sendqueue_transmit_dead;
3917 p->setuserbuffer_op = pcap_setuserbuffer_dead;
3918 p->live_dump_op = pcap_live_dump_dead;
3919 p->live_dump_ended_op = pcap_live_dump_ended_dead;
3920 p->get_airpcap_handle_op = pcap_get_airpcap_handle_dead;
3921#endif
3922 p->cleanup_op = pcap_cleanup_dead;
3923
3924 /*
3925 * A "dead" pcap_t never requires special BPF code generation.
3926 */
3927 p->bpf_codegen_flags = 0;
3928
3929 p->activated = 1;
3930 return (p);
3931}
3932
3933pcap_t *
3934pcap_open_dead(int linktype, int snaplen)
3935{
3936 return (pcap_open_dead_with_tstamp_precision(linktype, snaplen,
3937 PCAP_TSTAMP_PRECISION_MICRO));
3938}
3939
3940#ifdef YYDEBUG
3941/*
3942 * Set the internal "debug printout" flag for the filter expression parser.
3943 * The code to print that stuff is present only if YYDEBUG is defined, so
3944 * the flag, and the routine to set it, are defined only if YYDEBUG is
3945 * defined.
3946 *
3947 * This is intended for libpcap developers, not for general use.
3948 * If you want to set these in a program, you'll have to declare this
3949 * routine yourself, with the appropriate DLL import attribute on Windows;
3950 * it's not declared in any header file, and won't be declared in any
3951 * header file provided by libpcap.
3952 */
3953PCAP_API void pcap_set_parser_debug(int value);
3954
3955PCAP_API_DEF void
3956pcap_set_parser_debug(int value)
3957{
3958 pcap_debug = value;
3959}
3960#endif
